creditline: Gift of David Tausig Frank and Kazukuni Sugiyama
description: carton with tan banding on cream with brown "chops"; wooden box with inscriptions on both inside and outside of lid; tissue round scroll, paper around scroll inside tie; support fabric is cold with orange accent; image is two lines of calligraphy with two square chops LR and one rectangular chop UR
inscription:
竈山夜籟起　直到田水門　清石常滴海　終年惡浪翻 (Mount Kamayama—nighttime sounds arise / And continue all the way to Tamizu Gate. / Over pure rocks, always dripping into the sea, / All year long, dangerous waves churning.) [Jonathan Chaves]

(At Mount Kamayama, night sounds arise, / Wafted straight to Tamizu Gate. / Over pure rocks, forever pouring into the sea: / Down through the years, evil waves have churned.) [also Jonathan Chaves?]
markings: poem UR red seal: 无心 {mushin} [mushin #3]; poem LL red seals: 字曰子徳 {azana iwaku Shitoku}, 静處 {seisho} [seisho #3]
title: Mount Kamayama, Five-character Verse
